#How to compile and install Vala Toys for GEdit

== Prerequisites ==

 * glib (at least 2.12.0)
 * gtk+ (at least 2.10.0)
 * gedit (at least 2.22.0)
 * patched gtksourcecompletion (svn trunk at least rev. 162) see compiling http://gtksourcecomple.sourceforge.net/
 * gnome build framework (at least 2.23.90) 
 * vala 0.5.2 (svn trunk)

== Compiling ==

First at the moment you need vala compiler 0.5.2 - trunk:

{{{
svn checkout http://svn.gnome.org/svn/vala/trunk
}}}

Then the gtksourcecomplete sources:
{{{
svn checkout https://gtksourcecomple.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/gtksourcecomple/gtksourcecompletion/trunk 
}}}

with this patches applied:
01-build.patch
02-focus-fix.patch

and if you are on a debian system and you want to build deb archives:
03-debs.patch 

Patch Gsc with these commands from the gsc root source folder:
{{{
patch -p0 < 01-build.patch
patch -p0 < 02-focus-fix.patch
patch -p0 < 03-debs.patch 
}}}

You can compile _Vtg_ with:

{{{
./configure --prefix="your home dir"/.gnome2/gedit/plugins --datadir="your home dir"/.gnome2/gedit/plugins
./make
}}}

== Installing ==

From the root folder of Vtg distribution:

{{{
mkdir ~/.gnome2/gedit/plugins/vtg
cp -r images/ ~/.gnome2/gedit/plugins/vtg/
cp vtg/vtg.gedit-plugin ~/.gnome2/gedit/plugins/
cp vtg/.libs/libvtg.so ~/.gnome2/gedit/plugins/
}}}
